alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alaska Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 19 at 12:13PM AKDT until May 20 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT SATURDAY FOR EASTERN ALASKA RANGE... The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect until 1 AM AKDT Saturday. * AFFECTED AREA...Near the Delta River from Donnelly Dome north. * TIMING...Until 1 AM AKDT Saturday. * WINDS...South 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. South winds 30 mph with gusts to 45 mph south of Delta Junction in the evening and overnight. * HUMIDITY...As low as 24 percent. Relative humidities will only recover to around 50 percent on Friday night near Donnelly Dome. * TEMPERATURES...Around 70. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires are possible.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
